definitions.definition: the state of being sent to live in another country that is not your own, especially for political reasons or as a punishment

examples.text: He returned after 40 years of exile.
She has lived in exile since 1989.
The whole family went into exile.
Dante died in exile from Florence.
He still hopes to return from exile one day.
He went into exile after the overthrow of the government.
They are in tax exile from the UK.

definitions.definition: a person who chooses, or is forced, to live away from his or her own country

wordOrigin: Middle English: the noun partly from Old French exil ‘banishment’ and partly from Old French exile ‘banished person’; the verb from Old French exiler; all based on Latin exilium ‘banishment’, from exul ‘banished person’.
